definition[0]: to increase in quantity or amount, in a way that is difficult to manage
example[0]: It wasn’t long before the debts were piling up.
example[1]: The traffic starts piling up around this time.
example[2]: The work has a tendency to pile up if I’m not careful.
definition[1]: to arrange things in a pile
example[3]: tiny doughnuts piled up in a dish
